channel.title: Sigh

item.title: Sigh
item.dc:creator: @NexondotNet NexondotNet
item.description:
@NexondotNet wrote:

An int is an integer. You must apply a number when handling with ints.

Read full topic

item.title: Sigh
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

Well, I’m normally good with fixing my own errors, but I am COMPLETELY LOST on these. They are probably really easy to fix too. I got it while adding Wolf’s Mining to my WhiteScape based source.
Thanks if you can help me fix it!

Mining.java:168: AddGlobalObj(int,int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied t
o (int,int,int,int)
                                                        p.AddGlobalObj(server.ob
jectHandler.ObjectRockX[i], server.objectHandler.ObjectRockY[i], server.objectHa
ndler.ObjectEmptyRockID[i], 0);
                                                         ^
Mining.java:171: AddGlobalObj(int,int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied t
o (int,int,int,int)
                                                p.AddGlobalObj(server.objectHand
ler.ObjectRockX[i], server.objectHandler.ObjectRockY[i], server.objectHandler.Ob
jectRockID[i], 0);
                                                 ^
ObjectHandler.java:34: array required, but int found
                                                                server.playerHan
dler.players[j].ChangeDoor[i] = true;

                          ^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
3 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

EDIT: I have new errors from moving ResetRock(i); out of my ObjectHandler’s process().

ObjectHandler.java:23: invalid method declaration; return type required
                        ResetRock(i);
                        ^
ObjectHandler.java:23: <identifier> expected
                        ResetRock(i);
                                   ^
2 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
